title: Sheffield United striker Oli McBurnie charged with drink-driving ahead of Arsenal clash
text:

Sheffield United striker Oli McBurnie has been charged with drink-driving ahead of the Blades' Premier League clash against Arsenal this evening.

Scotland hitman McBurnie was held by police in the early hours of Friday morning after driving following a night out in West Yorkshire.

He was taken to a nearby station and charged with the offence.

A police spokesman told The Sun: "A 23-year-old Leeds man will appear before magistrates next month after being charged with a drink driving offence.

"Oliver McBurnie, from Leeds, will appear before Leeds Magistrates Court on November 6 after being charged with driving over the prescribed limit in Leeds in the early hours of Friday October 18."

(Image: PA)

McBurnie is due to appear at Leeds Magistrates Court in November.

United's club-record £20million summer signing has started each of their eight Premier League games so far this term.

He was forced out of international duty with Scotland for their 4-0 drubbing by Russia and 6-0 hammering of San Marino with a knee injury sustained in United's 0-0 draw at Watford earlier this month.

But he was expected to return to the side to face the Gunners at Bramall Lane tonight.

However, that has now been put in jeopardy by last week's incident and Blades boss Chris Wilder may be forced to shuffle his pack.

McBurnie came through the youth ranks at Bradford City before joining Swansea in 2015.

He hit 26 goals in 62 games for the Swans and joined United following the conclusion of last season.

Eight-cap international McBurnie has also had loan spells at Chester, Newport, Bristol Rovers and Barnsley.
